meanings.definition: The act or process of sanctifying or making holy.
meanings.sent1: The sanctification of the temple brought a sense of peace to the community.
meanings.sent2: The sanctification of the water before the ceremony was an important ritual.
meanings.sent3: The sanctification of the cupcakes with colorful sprinkles made them look even more delicious.
meanings.sent4: The sanctification of the garden transformed it into a serene sanctuary for birds and butterflies.
meanings.sent5: The sanctification of the old library breathed new life into its dusty shelves.

meanings.definition: The state of being sanctified or made holy.
meanings.sent1: The sanctification of the church was evident in the peaceful atmosphere within its walls.
meanings.sent2: The sanctification of the relics was a sacred ceremony attended by many believers.
meanings.sent3: The sanctification of the cat by the mischievous children involved placing a tiny crown on its head.
meanings.sent4: The sanctification of the mountain by the first snowfall gave it a majestic appearance.
meanings.sent5: The sanctification of the newborn baby brought joy and blessings to the family.
